ygData.subject: Re: NEAT Python - Hypercube support
ygData.msgSnippet: Are there plans to support HyperNEAT in the Python version?  I m much more comfortable with Python than C++.  With the new release of HyperSharpNEAT 2.0

Are there plans to support HyperNEAT in the Python version?  I'm much
more =
comfortable with Python than C++.  With the new release of
HyperSharpNEAT 2=
.0 (http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/software.html), there is a
substantial code bas=
e to draw from.

Also, I'd be interested to extend NEAT Python with Paralle=
l Python
(http://www.parallelpython.com/) to allow evaluations on multiple
=
cores and machines.

I've never worked with GPUs, but nVidia's CUDA capabil=
ities look
promising.  PyStream (http://code.google.com/p/pystream/) isn't =
being
supported anymore by Tech-X.  Their new GPUlib
(http://www.txcorp.com=
/technologies/GPULib/index.php) supports
multiple languages.  Again, this w=
ould be for evaluating fitness
functions.  Any experience or thoughts here?=


--Todd
